original_title: Russian flight permission delay causing shortfall in Sri Lanka’s tourists: SLTDA
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Tourism Development Authority told EconomyNext that the expected five Russian charter flights have been delayed due to a delay in clearance from the Civil Aviation Authority.
“We might experience a shortfall of 50,000 to 60,000 tourist arrivals,” SLTDA Chairperson Priyantha Fernando told EconomyNext on Monday (27).
The SLTDA predicted an arrival of 1.5 million tourists in 2023, with an average tourist spending estimated at 185 to 195 US dollars per day.
In May this year, the SLTA told EconomyNext that it was considering developing the marine tourism sector in Sri Lanka with the assistance of the Asian Development Bank.
“Sri Lanka expected the charter planes by December 1, however due to the delay in clearance the earliest operation date would be December 18,” Fernando said. (Colombo/Nov27/2023)
